channel.title: Yahoo News - Latest News & Headlines
channel.description: The latest news and headlines from Yahoo! News. Get breaking news stories and in-depth coverage with videos and photos.

item.title: Goodell: 'I got it wrong'
item.description: Goodell: Domestic abuse prevention training for all 32 NFL teams to begin next month.
item.media:text: Goodell: Domestic abuse prevention training for all 32 NFL teams to begin next month.

item.title: 225 victims of MH17 identified
item.description: Forensic experts have identified a total of 225 victims of downed Malaysia Airlines flight MH17, with 14 new names released to families, Dutch authorities said on Friday.
item.media:text: Forensic experts have identified a total of 225 victims of downed Malaysia Airlines flight MH17, with 14 new names released to families, Dutch authorities said on Friday.

item.title: Ex-Gov. Rowland convicted in finance scheme
item.description: A jury convicted former Conn. Gov. John Rowland of crimes in a campaign finance scheme.
item.media:text: A jury convicted former Conn. Gov. John Rowland of crimes in a campaign finance scheme.

item.title: Suspect in Bali suitcase murder confesses
item.description: A U.S. man detained in Bali has confessed to killing his girlfriend's mother and stuffing her body into a suitcase, police confirmed on Friday. Tommy Schaefer, 21, and Heather Mack, 19, both from Chicago, were arrested on Aug. 13 after the battered body of Sheila von Weise-Mack was found in a bloody suitcase outside a luxury hotel on the resort island in Indonesia. Police said the suspects made separate confessions in which Schaefer admitted to killing Wiese-Mack, 62, and Mack, who is three months pregnant, admitted to helping him stuff her body into the suitcase. ...
item.media:text: A U.S. man detained in Bali has confessed to killing his girlfriend's mother and stuffing her body into a suitcase, police confirmed on Friday. Tommy Schaefer, 21, and Heather Mack, 19, both from Chicago, were arrested on Aug. 13 after the battered body of Sheila von Weise-Mack was found in a bloody suitcase outside a luxury hotel on the resort island in Indonesia. Police said the suspects made separate confessions in which Schaefer admitted to killing Wiese-Mack, 62, and Mack, who is three months pregnant, admitted to helping him stuff her body into the suitcase. ...

item.title: Scots' 'No' doesn't stop Catalan secession push
item.description: Parliament in Spain's Catalonia region gives leader power to call secession referendum.
item.media:text: Parliament in Spain's Catalonia region gives leader power to call secession referendum.

item.title: Vienna's Jewish Museum returns painting seized by Nazis to heirs
item.description: A Jewish museum in Vienna returned a painting that was seized by the Nazis in 1938 to the artist's grandnieces on Friday, part of a wider move in Austria to deal with art illegally acquired after Germany annexed the country in 1938. The 1922 work "The coffee hour. Fanny, the sister of the artist" by Jewish artist Jehudo Epstein, was handed to the granddaughter of the woman in the painting, Anne Starkey, who traveled from Britain to receive the piece, the museum said.

item.title: White House anti-assault campaign uses stars, sports to reach campuses
item.description: By Susan Heavey WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Barack Obama and Vice President Joe Biden, who have long talked about the need to curb sexual assault at universities, got some help on Friday from the people many young adults actually listen to: celebrities and athletes. In its latest effort to help college campuses confront the issue, the White House is relying on a combination of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, social media and star power to spread its message aimed at preventing and coping with such assaults. ...
item.media:text: By Susan Heavey WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Barack Obama and Vice President Joe Biden, who have long talked about the need to curb sexual assault at universities, got some help on Friday from the people many young adults actually listen to: celebrities and athletes. In its latest effort to help college campuses confront the issue, the White House is relying on a combination of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, social media and star power to spread its message aimed at preventing and coping with such assaults. ...

item.title: NFL's Goodell signals major shift in personal conduct policy
item.description: By Larry Fine NEW YORK (Reuters) - National Football League Commissioner Roger Goodell said on Friday that rules governing personal conduct will change, signaling a major shift in policy in the wake of the league's poor handling of domestic abuse cases. Goodell said a committee will be established by the NFL to review policy but he avoided commenting on what the change will mean for his overriding power in the disciplinary process. ...
item.media:text: By Larry Fine NEW YORK (Reuters) - National Football League Commissioner Roger Goodell said on Friday that rules governing personal conduct will change, signaling a major shift in policy in the wake of the league's poor handling of domestic abuse cases. Goodell said a committee will be established by the NFL to review policy but he avoided commenting on what the change will mean for his overriding power in the disciplinary process. ...

item.title: Former Connecticut Governor Rowland found guilty of campaign law violations
item.description: By Richard Weizel NEW HAVEN Conn. (Reuters) - Former Connecticut Governor John Rowland violated U.S. election laws by taking under-the-table payments from a business owned by the husband of a candidate whose campaign he secretly advised, a federal jury found on Friday. Rowland, a Republican who resigned from office a decade ago after admitting to taking gifts from people who did business with the state, was found guilty of seven criminal counts including two of falsifying records in a federal investigation. ...
item.media:text: By Richard Weizel NEW HAVEN Conn. (Reuters) - Former Connecticut Governor John Rowland violated U.S. election laws by taking under-the-table payments from a business owned by the husband of a candidate whose campaign he secretly advised, a federal jury found on Friday. Rowland, a Republican who resigned from office a decade ago after admitting to taking gifts from people who did business with the state, was found guilty of seven criminal counts including two of falsifying records in a federal investigation. ...

item.title: Islamic State captures 60 Syrian villages
item.description: Islamic State jihadists have seized 60 Kurdish villages near the Turkish border in a lightning two-day campaign, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said Friday.
item.media:text: Islamic State jihadists have seized 60 Kurdish villages near the Turkish border in a lightning two-day campaign, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said Friday.

item.title: 3 guilty in Ga. salmonella-tainted peanut trial
item.description: The head of a peanut company that distributed salmonella-tainted peanuts that sickened hundreds of people across the U.S. five years ago has been convicted of conspiracy and other charges.
item.media:text: The head of a peanut company that distributed salmonella-tainted peanuts that sickened hundreds of people across the U.S. five years ago has been convicted of conspiracy and other charges.

item.title: Unemployment rises in 24 U.S. states
item.description: Unemployment rates rose in nearly half of U.S. states in August, even as employers in two-thirds of the states added jobs.
item.media:text: Unemployment rates rose in nearly half of U.S. states in August, even as employers in two-thirds of the states added jobs.

item.title: Obama: Campus sex assault an 'affront to our basic humanity'
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Amid a new focus on violence against women, President Barack Obama kicked off a star-powered campaign Friday against campus sexual assault particularly targeted at encouraging men to take a stand.
item.media:text: WASHINGTON (AP) — Amid a new focus on violence against women, President Barack Obama kicked off a star-powered campaign Friday against campus sexual assault particularly targeted at encouraging men to take a stand.

item.title: From gangsta rapper to Islamist militant
item.description: As war in Syria and Iraq attracts a growing number of Muslim extremists from Europe, intelligence officials in Germany believe a former gangsta rapper has joined the inner circle of Islamists fighting there.
item.media:text: As war in Syria and Iraq attracts a growing number of Muslim extremists from Europe, intelligence officials in Germany believe a former gangsta rapper has joined the inner circle of Islamists fighting there.

item.title: Scottish nationalist leader quits
item.description: Alex Salmond resigned as leader of his party Friday, will quit as First Minister after losing independence referendum.
item.media:text: Alex Salmond resigned as leader of his party Friday, will quit as First Minister after losing independence referendum.

item.title: Congress backs Obama on aid to Syrian rebels
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Legislation requested by President Barack Obama authorizing the military to arm and train moderate Syrian rebels fighting Islamic State militants in the Middle East is headed for his signature after a sweeping Senate vote.
item.media:text: WASHINGTON (AP) — Legislation requested by President Barack Obama authorizing the military to arm and train moderate Syrian rebels fighting Islamic State militants in the Middle East is headed for his signature after a sweeping Senate vote.

item.title: Alibaba shares jump 46 percent on NYSE debut
item.description: (Reuters) - Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's shares rose as much as 46 percent in their first day of trading on Friday, lifting the Chinese online retailer's value to $244 billion. The company's initial public offering, on track to be the biggest ever if underwriters exercise their option to sell more shares, will help fund Alibaba's expansion in the United States and elsewhere. The sale raised more than $8.2 billion for the company after fees for underwriters, and about $13 billion for major shareholders. Alibaba's shares were trading at $99 on the New York Stock Exchange at 11:58 a.m. ...
item.media:text: (Reuters) - Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's shares rose as much as 46 percent in their first day of trading on Friday, lifting the Chinese online retailer's value to $244 billion. The company's initial public offering, on track to be the biggest ever if underwriters exercise their option to sell more shares, will help fund Alibaba's expansion in the United States and elsewhere. The sale raised more than $8.2 billion for the company after fees for underwriters, and about $13 billion for major shareholders. Alibaba's shares were trading at $99 on the New York Stock Exchange at 11:58 a.m. ...

item.title: Watch: Alibaba makes its NYSE debut
item.description: Yahoo Finance's live coverage of Alibaba's anticipated IPO.
item.media:text: Yahoo Finance's live coverage of Alibaba's anticipated IPO.

item.title: Exclusive: Surf wisdom with Tulsi Gabbard, first Hindu congresswoman
item.description: Yahoo News goes surfing with Hawaii Rep. Tulsi Gabbard, a war veteran and the first Hindu congresswoman.
item.media:text: Yahoo News goes surfing with Hawaii Rep. Tulsi Gabbard, a war veteran and the first Hindu congresswoman.

item.title: Alibaba IPO a Wall Street ‘feeding frenzy’
item.description: From Yahoo Finance: Pro looks at anticipated offering. PLUS: Live show 10:15 ET.
item.media:text: From Yahoo Finance: Pro looks at anticipated offering. PLUS: Live show 10:15 ET.

item.title: Florida granddad who killed family fatally shot son years before
item.description: The Florida man who police say gunned down his daughter and six grandchildren Thursday had been to prison for fatally shooting his young son during a hunting trip 13 years ago, according to court records.
item.media:text: The Florida man who police say gunned down his daughter and six grandchildren Thursday had been to prison for fatally shooting his young son during a hunting trip 13 years ago, according to court records.

item.title: Scots reject independence from U.K.
item.description: Voters decide that Scotland will remain part of the United Kingdom.
item.media:text: Voters decide that Scotland will remain part of the United Kingdom.

item.title: Fatal police shooting near St. Louis — 2nd since Ferguson
item.description: Officers shot and killed a man after he allegedly pointed a rifle at them in suburban St. Louis, the second fatal police shooting of a black suspect in the region since the August shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson.
item.media:text: Officers shot and killed a man after he allegedly pointed a rifle at them in suburban St. Louis, the second fatal police shooting of a black suspect in the region since the August shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson.

item.title: Police seek gunman at Phoenix's Sky Harbor airport
item.description: Police in Arizona arrested one man and were seeking another at Phoenix's Sky Harbor International Airport on Thursday after officers pursued a car there carrying suspects in a shooting at a nearby gas station forecourt, authorities said. No one was being allowed into the airport's Terminal Four due to police activity, and people were told to avoid the area, said Sergeant Steve Martos, a Phoenix Police Department spokesman. Sergeant Mike Pooley of the Tempe Police Department said a patrol car had followed the suspect vehicle from the scene of the shooting to the airport. ...
item.media:text: Police in Arizona arrested one man and were seeking another at Phoenix's Sky Harbor International Airport on Thursday after officers pursued a car there carrying suspects in a shooting at a nearby gas station forecourt, authorities said. No one was being allowed into the airport's Terminal Four due to police activity, and people were told to avoid the area, said Sergeant Steve Martos, a Phoenix Police Department spokesman. Sergeant Mike Pooley of the Tempe Police Department said a patrol car had followed the suspect vehicle from the scene of the shooting to the airport. ...

item.title: Obama: 'We do not give in to fear'
item.description: The president says airstrikes on the Islamic State will continue.
item.media:text: The president says airstrikes on the Islamic State will continue.

item.title: 8 killed in attack on Guinea Ebola education team
item.description: Eight bodies, including those of three journalists, were found after an attack on a team trying to educate locals on the risks of the Ebola virus in a remote area of southeastern Guinea, a government spokesman said on Thursday. "The eight bodies were found in the village latrine. Three of them had their throats slit," Damantang Albert Camara told Reuters by telephone in Conakry. However, Guinea's Prime Minister Mohamed Saïd Fofana, speaking in a television message that had been recorded earlier, said 7 bodies of 9 missing people had been found. ...
item.media:text: Eight bodies, including those of three journalists, were found after an attack on a team trying to educate locals on the risks of the Ebola virus in a remote area of southeastern Guinea, a government spokesman said on Thursday. "The eight bodies were found in the village latrine. Three of them had their throats slit," Damantang Albert Camara told Reuters by telephone in Conakry. However, Guinea's Prime Minister Mohamed Saïd Fofana, speaking in a television message that had been recorded earlier, said 7 bodies of 9 missing people had been found. ...

item.title: Kansas court orders removal of Democrat from Senate ballot
item.description: The Kansas Supreme Court has ordered the state to remove U.S. Senate Democratic nominee Chad Taylor's name from the ballot, in a ruling that could influence the national fight for control of the Senate.
item.media:text: The Kansas Supreme Court has ordered the state to remove U.S. Senate Democratic nominee Chad Taylor's name from the ballot, in a ruling that could influence the national fight for control of the Senate.

item.title: Sierra Leone to shut down for 3 days to slow Ebola
item.description: In a desperate bid to slow West Africa's accelerating Ebola outbreak, Sierra Leone ordered its 6 million people confined to their homes for three days starting Friday while volunteers conduct a house-to-house search for victims in hiding.
item.media:text: In a desperate bid to slow West Africa's accelerating Ebola outbreak, Sierra Leone ordered its 6 million people confined to their homes for three days starting Friday while volunteers conduct a house-to-house search for victims in hiding.

item.title: Vote counting begins in Scotland
item.description: Historic referendum will decide whether Scotland ends its 307-year-old union with England.
item.media:text: Historic referendum will decide whether Scotland ends its 307-year-old union with England.

item.title: Home Depot says breach affected 56M payment cards
item.description: The Home Depot says it has eliminated malware from its U.S. and Canadian networks that affected 56 million unique payment cards between April and September. The Atlanta-based home improvement retailer ...
item.media:text: The Home Depot says it has eliminated malware from its U.S. and Canadian networks that affected 56 million unique payment cards between April and September. The Atlanta-based home improvement retailer ...

item.title: Call to arms issued as Islamic State gains in Syria
item.description: Islamic State fighters have besieged a Kurdish city in Syria after seizing 21 villages.
item.media:text: Islamic State fighters have besieged a Kurdish city in Syria after seizing 21 villages.

item.title: Larry Ellison steps down as CEO of Oracle
item.description: Oracle said Larry Ellison, its co-founder and longtime CEO, will be stepping down, effective immediately.
item.media:text: Oracle said Larry Ellison, its co-founder and longtime CEO, will be stepping down, effective immediately.

item.title: Wanna bet? British man bets $1.5M on Scottish referendum
item.description: A British businessman is betting nearly $1.5 million (£900,000) that Scotland will vote "no" to independence on Thursday.
item.media:text: A British businessman is betting nearly $1.5 million (£900,000) that Scotland will vote "no" to independence on Thursday.

item.title: Arson suspect arrested in 'King' wildfire
item.description: A man has been arrested on arson charges in an out-of-control Northern Calif. wildfire.
item.media:text: A man has been arrested on arson charges in an out-of-control Northern Calif. wildfire.

item.title: 30 killed in series of attacks in Iraq
item.description: Iraqi authorities say a suicide bombing and mortar fire have killed another 15 people in the capital late Thursday, raising the day's death toll from attacks to 30.
item.media:text: Iraqi authorities say a suicide bombing and mortar fire have killed another 15 people in the capital late Thursday, raising the day's death toll from attacks to 30.

item.title: Captive British journalist appears in new IS video
item.description: Captive British journalist John Cantlie says he will soon reveal "facts" in propaganda video.
item.media:text: Captive British journalist John Cantlie says he will soon reveal "facts" in propaganda video.
